constructed slightly differently

renderpass.code:
#define rot(a)    mat2(cos(a+vec4(0,.5,-.5,0)*pi))

void mainImage(out vec4 O, vec2 U)
{
    float t = 9., pi = acos(-1.), r = pi/5., a, b;
    vec3  R = iResolution,
          D = normalize(2. * vec3(U, -R.y) - R),              // ray dir
          p = vec3(0,0,12),                                   // point along ray
          q,                                                  // temp
          C = iMouse.z > 0. ? 8. * iMouse.xyz / R - 4.        // look
                         : 3. * cos(.3*iTime + vec3(0,11,0)); // demo mode
    for (O=vec4(1); O.x > 0. && t > .01; O-=.005)             // march scene
        q = p, 
        q.yz *= rot(-C.y),                                    
        q.xz *= rot(-C.x),
        a = atan(q.z, q.y),
        b = round(a/r),
        q.zy *= rot(b*r),
        q.y -= 4.,
        a = atan(q.x, q.y),
        b = round(a/r),
        q.xy *= rot(b*r),
        t = q.y - 1.,                                         // approx dist to surf
        p += .2*t*D;                                          // step 
 
    O *= O*O*O*2.;                                            // shade
}
